subject: Philosophy
title: Mindfulness Goes Mainstream
description: Learn Mindfulness Goes Mainstream in one minute.

hook.text: In 1979, Jon Kabat-Zinn stripped mindfulness of its religious context and brought it into hospitals.

buildup.text: His Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction program proved that meditation reduces pain and anxiety.

discovery.text: Thousands of clinical studies followed. Mindfulness became one of the most researched interventions in psychology.

twist.text: Buddhist monks watched with mixed feelings. The practice worked, but the philosophy got left behind.

climax.text: Today mindfulness is in schools, prisons, and boardrooms. Its Eastern roots are often invisible.

punchline.text: The West adopted the technique and forgot the teacher.

quiz.question: Who brought mindfulness into clinical settings?
